IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE HOMES AND SUPPORT TO ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE HOMES AND SUPPORT TO ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SO THAT THEY MAY LIVE THEIR LIVES WITH GREATER INDEPENDENCE AND OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL - PROVIDING HOMES, SUPPORT AND OTHER SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPPORTED LIVING SERVICES - PROVIDE INDIVIDUALIZED SUPPORTS, DELIVERED IN A PERSONALIZED MANNER, TO INDIVIDUALS WHO LIVE IN HOMES OF THEIR CHOICE, WITH WHOM AND WHERE THEY WANT TO LIVE, AND THE TYPE OF COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES IN WHICH THEY WISH TO BE INVOLVES BASED ON THEIR PERSONAL RESOURCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY LEARNING SERVICES - PROVIDE SERVICES THAT PROVIDE INDIVIDUALS TRAINING, OPPORTUNITIES, AND SUPPORTS THAT BUILD ON AN INDIVIDUALS STRENGTHS. SERVICES SHALL INCREASE INDIVIDUAL INDEPENDENCE AND REDUCE LEVEL OF SERVICE NEED.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: PERSONAL SUPPORTS - PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES BOTH AT HOME AND IN THE COMMUNITY TO SUPPORT EACH PERSON IN IDENTIFYING AND ACHIEVING THIER GOALS, TO MAXIMIZE INDEPENDENCE AND TO INCREASE COMMUNITY PRESENCE AND PARTICIPATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE GUIDANCE OF ASC 740-10, "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES" WHICH CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR THE RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF THE BENEFITS OF INDIVIDUAL TAX POSITIONS IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, INCLUDING THOSE OF NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. TAX POSITIONS MUST MEET A RECOGNITION OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT IN ORDER FOR THE BENEFIT OF THOSE TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION ANALYZES TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO THE REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN IRC SEC. 501(C) TO QUALIFY AS A TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY VOLUNTEERS AND BOARD MEMBERS, THE REPORTING OF UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME,, AND ITS STATUS AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER MARYLAND STATE STATUTE. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT KNOW OF ANY TAX BENEFITS ARISING FROM UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND THERE WAS NO EFFECT ON THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL POSITION OR CHANGES IN NET ASSETS AS A RESULT OF ANALYZING ITS TAX POSITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KIMBERLY BRETON, WHO IS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS MARRIED TO AN EMPLOYEE OF LGI. JOHN (HUSBAND) REPORTS DIRECTLY TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND NOT KIMBERLY. THERE ARE PROPER SEGREGATION OF DUTIES AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS INVOLVED WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION THAT WOULD CAPTURE ANY SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE RECEIVES A DRAFT VERSION OF THE FORM 990 THAT IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED. AFTER THE FINANCE COMMITTEE APPROVES THE DRAFT 990, ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE PROVIDED A COPY OF THE DRAFT VERSION OF THE FORM 990. THE FINAL FORM 990 IS FILED WITH THE IRS AFTER ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS GIVE THEIR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES ALL DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO REVIEW CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES AND SIGN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEWS ALL SIGNED ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS AND BRINGS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR RESOLUTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS COMPENSATION OF TOP MANAGEMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION BY REVIEWING BUDGETS AND COMPENSATION OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE REPORTED ON THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS DESIGNATES A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND APPROVE THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS COMPENSATION. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ALSO REVIEWS COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS BY SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION FOR KEY EMPLOYEE POSITIONS, INCLUDING THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND DEPUTY DIRECTOR, BY ALSO USING THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 1023 AND FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON WRITTEN REQUEST. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO PUBLICLY AVAILABLE ON GUIDESTAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.

CONSULTANTS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 71,737. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 37,467. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 109,204. CONTRACTED SUPPORT STAFF: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,356,530. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 100,559. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 1,457,089.
THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
